summary: The City of Chicago and the Chicago Cubs Baseball Club dispute ownership of a $5,300,000 parking lot near Wrigley Field. A settlement is proposed, and the Club plans a $32.1 million Security Enhancement Project, supported by a $12 million State Grant and a City Contribution from the CubFund. The Club will maintain and repair public safety improvements. In exchange, the City will vacate and quitclaim to the Club the easternmost 56’ of the property (Team Parcel), and the Club will dedicate the westernmost 4’ (City Parcel) to the City, complying with the Chicago Zoning Ordinance.
